alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:31PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN COSHOCTON AND TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 731 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Newcomerstown, or 12 miles southwest of New Philadelphia, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... New Philadelphia, Dover, Coshocton, Uhrichsville, Newcomerstown, Dennison, West Lafayette, Sugarcreek, Gnadenhutten, Tuscarawas, Baltic, Midvale, Port Washington, Barnhill, Roswell, Parral, Stone Creek, Gilmore, Chili, and Bakersville. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 61 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
